snippet: The Postal Service said a five-day mail delivery schedule would begin in August and would shave about $2 billion a year from its losses, which were $15.9 billion last year.
abstract: Postal Service will seek to stop Saturday delivery of letters; says five-day mail delivery schedule will begin in August 2013 and will shave about $2 billion a year from its losses, which were $15.9 billion in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The Postal Service said a five-day mail delivery schedule would begin in August and would shave about $2 billion a year from its losses, which were $15.9 billion last year.

headline.seo: Postal Service Plans to End Saturday Delivery
headline.main: Trying to Stem Losses, Post Office Seeks to End Saturday Letter Delivery
headline.print_headline: Trying to Stem Losses, Post Office Seeks to End Saturday Letter Delivery
